summary: PMXT scanner produces ZERO valid signals. 100% of divergence signals are false positives from bad fuzzy matching.

false_matches.issue: US GDP growth brackets matched to UK GDP Q1 negative — completely different markets, different countries, different question types

root_causes: Fuzzy matching thresholds too low (0.30 event, 0.35 market) — lets through garbage pairs
No semantic validation — matches US GDP to UK GDP because words overlap
Kalshi has many bracket markets (>X%, <Y%) that match to binary Polymarket questions
cross-platform-results.json even worse: matched 'Senate Control' to 'Grenell leading Venezuela'
Only 17 pairs found out of 980×600 possible — scanner coverage is tiny even before quality issues

reasoning: Zero valid divergence signals in current output
The 6 legitimate pairs all show alignment (<3¢ diff), proving markets agree when properly matched
Scanner burns compute/tokens every 4 hours for nothing
Even if matching were perfect, the legitimate pairs show Kalshi and Polymarket price nearly identically — no exploitable edge
if_revisiting_later: Need curated pair mapping (manual or LLM-verified), not fuzzy string matching
Focus on high-overlap categories: politics, Fed, major events
Require match confidence >0.85 before generating signals
Add entity-level validation (same country, same time period, same question type)

backtest_feasibility: NOT_POSSIBLE — no historical divergence data exists because the scanner has never produced a valid signal to track. The 6 legitimate pairs are all aligned, confirming there's no cross-platform edge to exploit.
